Description: Faience bowl with adhering kiln support: it can be seen here that the widest surface of a kiln support has become stuck to the blue glaze on the base of a bowl. The upper part of the cone has disappeared.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W. M. F. Petrie, 'Memphis' I ('British School of Archaeology in Egypt' no. 15.) (London, 1909), pp. 14-15 W. M. F. Petrie, "The Pottery Kilns at Memphis" in E. B. Knobel et. al (eds.), 'Historical Studies. (British School of Archaeology in Egypt: Studies.' Vol. 19) (London, 1911),pl. xviii; Vandiver in A. Kaczmarczyk & R. E.M. Hedges 'Ancient Egyptian faience : an analytical survey of Egyptian faience from predynastic to Roman times' (Warminster, 1983), p. A31.
Bibliographic references: Friedman 1998 / Gifts of the Nile: Ancient Egyptian Faience (179)
Acquisition name: Donated by: British School of Archaeology, Egypt
Donated through: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
